# Drone News 48h Brief — December 23, 2025

_Window: last 48 hours; 48 incidents._

## Summary
In the past 48 hours, various drone incidents predominantly related to arrests, crashes, and smuggling have emerged across multiple locations. Notably, four individuals were arrested in Bangkok and Thailand, linked to drone disruptions at Suvarnabhumi Airport, drawing attention to the growing security concerns surrounding airport operations. Germany continues to report more than 1,000 suspicious drone flights, indicating significant unauthorized aerial activity, especially near military sites. Meanwhile, Jordanian border forces intercepted drug-laden drones, highlighting ongoing smuggling challenges. The risks surrounding drone use in prisons were underscored by ongoing contraband issues, including a case in South Carolina where various items were dropped via drone. This period reflects increasing security alerts and governmental responses to combat unauthorized drone activities.

**By category:** airport: 5 • arrest: 4 • crash: 9 • other: 22 • smuggling: 8
**Top queries:** drone incident (16), drone crash (8), drone smuggling (6), unauthorized drone (5), drone airport disruption (4)

## Clusters
